definition: good (virtuous)/benevolent/well-disposed/good at sth/to improve or perfect

sentences.english: Kind words are the music of the world.
Comfort your hearts, and stablish you in every good word and work.
sentences.chinese: 安慰你们的心，并且在一切善行善言上，坚固你们。

sentences.english: I pristine father and brother, always ineloquent.
sentences.chinese: 我质朴的父兄，向来不善言辞。

sentences.english: This time, always ineloquent of John Woo, but very embarrassed.
sentences.chinese: 这下，素来不善言辞的吴宇森可是相当不好意思。

sentences.english: He that would live in peace and rest must hear and see, and say the best.
sentences.chinese: 要想太安宁平，生活安定，必须耳聪目明，善言入耳。

sentences.english: He's clever and articulate and has a conscience.
A: I hate guys who are no talk and all hands.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌男人不善言辞，只是动手动脚。

sentences.english: I hate guys who arn no talk and all hands.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌男人不善言辞，只是动手动脚。

sentences.english: May a kind of world, a reassuring touch, a warm smile be yours every day of your life.
sentences.chinese: 愿宽慰善言，舒心触抚，暖意笑容与君相随每一天。

sentences.english: I. e. , To speak saintly words with the noble souls are truth.
sentences.chinese: 心怀高尚的灵魂并说一些圣洁的话就是善言。

sentences.english: So do I. I like those guys who are bold but cautious.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌男人不善言辞，只是动手动脚。

good (virtuous)/benevolent/well-disposed/good at sth/to improve or perfect
to be of service to others/to help others/benevolent
sensible/reasonable/an obvious reason, truth or fact/to understand the reason or reasoning
people of good will (idiom); charitable person
to do good works/to be merciful
to be glib in one's speech and wear an ingratiating expression (idiom)
